reviews.review_msg: For a 2nd year course on ads this was pretty heavy on theory for the first half. If you can make it through the Marx and Adorno you are good to go for the second half. This was the instructor's first time lecturing and it showed at times -- i've had him as a TA for courses that rocked, like the myth course, and he was one of the best TAs ever.
Took this course by distance ed. with Kate as tutor-marker. She's a pretty easy marker.

I took the distance ed version so he's just the course chair. Assignments were fair and there was no midterm. Final tested our broad understanding not specifics. Overall a good class, would recommend!

Avoid him at all cost. Strangely-worded papers and lengthy emails leave you in the dark. He TRIES to be helpful, but it just doesn't work out. Lots and lots of reading. Make sure your writing skill is solid when taking this course.

He's a picky. For a professor he doesn't really use much thinking.  Snow=SFU closed, how are we supposed to hand in assignments when the fax method does not work properly, does not allow emails.  Just plain ridiculous.
Watch out. Assignments are vague at best. The prof is anal about citations. Cite everything.

i've never heard of having to cite readings in a closed book mid-term.  what's that all about?  This guy has a real thing for referencing the course reader even in creative writing.  If you chose to take this class, make sure to cite everything you write or else.

To paraphrase: "I'[ll] never let my school interfere with my education" - Twain. I am sad to realize that our education is being taken away from us. Because when given the opportunity to explore, we were penalized. All because we didn't cite the guide that we assumed was a given. My vigor for this class has been taken away. Thank you Prof. Chunn.

Absolutely terrible I am only about 3 weeks into this class and I am already so angry I wish I could launch a formal complaint.  He does not appear to understand citation as he wants it on everything including creative assignments and closed book midterms.  Despite numerous emails he has not adequately responded appropriately to anything.
Was course supervisor for CMNS 372 distance ed.  Assignments were slow coming back and he didn't care to respond to emails.  Seemed lazy, but hey, I would be too if it was possible.
